content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

To extract questions and answers from markdown-formatted text in Julia, you can use the following function:

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::String)
    # Regular expressions to match Question and Answer headers
    question_re = r"^#\sQuestion\s+([^\n]+)"m
    answer_re = r"^#\sAnswer\s+([^\n]+)"m

    # RegexMatchs to capture the text after the header
    matches = match.((question_re, answer_re), md)

    # Extract questions and answers
    questions = map(matches[1]) do m
        m.match[end - min(length(m.captures)) + 1 : end]
    end
    answers = map(matches[2]) do m
        m.match[end - min(length(m.captures)) + 1 : end]
    end

    # Remove leading spaces and newlines from extracted text
    return tuple((strip(q, whitespace=true) for q in questions)..., (strip(a, whitespace=true) for a in answers)...)
end
```

This function uses regular expressions to match headers starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`. It captures the text that follows these headers and then strips any leading spaces or newlines from the extracted text using the `strip(str, whitespace=true)` method. Finally, it returns a tuple containing the questions and answers.

Please note that this function assumes that there is at least one `# Question` and `# Answer` section in the markdown text provided. If you have any additional requirements or need to handle more complex markdown formats, please provide more information so I can update the function accordingly.
